title: Lady Gaga has almost her 'entire body' X-rayed after being DROPPED by a fan during Las Vegas show
text:
She was just seen tumbling off stage after being picked up by an adoring fan during a performance in Las Vegas on Thursday.

And Lady Gaga had to have 'almost' her entire body X-rayed on Friday to check for broken bones, following the shocking incident.

The Judas songstress, 33, gave fans an update via Instagram - and indicated she was A-ok in an amusing X-ray snap.

Scroll down to see video

She's all right folks: Lady Gaga had to have 'almost' her entire body X-rayed on Friday to check for broken bones, following a shocking incident in which she was dropped off stage by a fan

The pop sensation shared a photo of her arm X-ray, in which she gave the 'OK' gesture to fans.

Gaga captioned the post, 'When they have to X-Ray almost your entire body...Just Dance.'

'Gonna be ok'.

Also on Friday, the Born This Way singer shared a photo to her Instagram Story showing herself heading to a friend's bachelorette party.

The singer, whose real name is Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta, wore a pair of bridesmaid glasses as she posed for the selfie.

Stepping out: Just one day after falling off stage the 33-year-old stepped out to celebrate her best friend's bachelorette party

She had her bright pink hair curled with some bold eyeliner and mascara along with some pink eyeshadow.

'I might be in a lot of pain by I couldn't miss my best friend's bachelorette dinner. I [love] you @sarahtannomakeup,' she said in the photo.

She seemed in good spirits as she celebrated with her friend Sarah who is a makeup artist as well as Gaga's makeup brand Haus of Gaga's Global Artistry Director.

Post show: The Born This Way star revealed that after her ice bath, she swapped to hot water for 20 minutes, as part of her post-performance ritual

Looking good: Earlier in the day, the singer posted her pre-show regime of doing some laps in the pool, alongside a sizzling picture as she posed in a neon pink swimsuit

Worrying footage of the A Star Is Born actress being picked up by a fan whose leg buckled sending the pair tumbling off stage emerged online on Thursday.

The fall was captured during her Enigma Residency show in Las Vegas while the superstar was performing.

The shocking moment was captured by screaming fans who witnessed the tumble from a number of angles.

In the clip the fan, who is thought to be called Jack, can be seen holding the 33-year-old, 5ft 1in star, who is said to weight a slight 117lbs.

Oops! Gaga was involved in a scary accident during her Las Vegas show on Thursday after a fan, thought to be called Jack, picked her up but his leg buckled

Shocked: Gaga had her legs wrapped around Jack's waist as he tried to dance to her song

Tumble: The musician and Jack were dancing on stage when they both fell off the edge, causing security to rush over to help them

Lady Gaga, who lives with fibromyalgia which causes increased sensitivity to pain, appeared comfortable as she held her microphone in one hand and placed her arm around Jack's neck.

However, Jack suddenly lost his footing as his leg fell from under him on the narrow stage and the pair toppled to the floor.

From videos shot by fans in the crowd, it appeared Gaga hit the floor first and Jack ended up crashing down on top of her as the audience gasped and screamed.

It was Gaga's first performance back on stage since taking a break for the summer.

Lift: From a different angle, fan Jack could be seen dancing with Gaga wrapped around his waist while standing perilously close to the edge

After getting back onto the stage, Gaga showed she was a professional and tried to reassure Jack that she wasn't injured.

Gaga went on to perform song Million Reasons with Jack next to her, telling the crowd: 'It's amazing. We love each other so much we fell off the damn stage.'

She also asked the upset fan not to dwell on the incident, saying 'Could you forgive yourself right now for what just happened?', reports the BBC.

Balance: The man suddenly ended up losing his footing, causing the two of them to fall

In a post on Reddit after the show finished one audience member said: 'I was there. We legitimately all thought she was dead.

'Then she brought him up on stage and asked everyone on the internet to be nice to him, and played the next song with him like nothing even happened. Poor guy was crying most of the time until she cheered him up.'

On Thursday the singer also posted her pre-show plans with a sizzling picture of her posing in a neon pink swimsuit as she climbed out of the pool.

Gaga wrote: 'Pre-show routine: Hard workout and then Galactic Laps. GagaPhelps.'
description: Lady Gaga had to have 'almost' her entire body X-rayed on Friday to check for broken bones, following the shocking incident.
